text: ANNOUNCEMENTS: Twenty First Amendment to the Constitution: Determination of the Supreme Court ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS PRIVILEGE MOTIONS: Programme aired by Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation on 6th June 2013 ABHIMANI SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT AND CULTURAL FOUNDATION
(INCORPORATION) BILL: Read a Second time, and allocated to Standing Committee A
TWENTY FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION :

I wish to announce to the House that I have received the Determination of the Supreme Court in respect of the Bill titled Twenty First Amendment to the Constitution which has been challenged in the Supreme Court in terms of Article 121(1) of the Constitution.

The Court has determined that in terms of Article 123 of the Constitution, the Petition filed by the Petitioner is misconceived in law and premised on a footing in contravention of the jurisdiction conferred on the Court by proviso (a) to Article 120 read with Article 124 of the Constitution.
I order that the Determination of the Supreme Court be printed in the Official Report of todays Proceedings.

MINISTRY OF EXTERNAL AFFAIRS : KEY OFFICIALS
asked the Minister of External Affairs:
(a) Will he inform this House, separately -
(i) the key officials of the Ministry;
(ii) the work experiences of each official
(i) the number of Sri Lankan employees
working under the Ministry of External Affairs worldwide; and
(ii) as to how they report to the Ministry with
Hon. Member, shall I read out the Answers one by one?
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Deputy Speaker, the microphone system is malfunctioning. I cannot hear what is being said.
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) Hon. Member, you have asked for the list of - ( )
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) I am sorry, Hon. Deputy Minister. First, I want to get the House in order because what you are saying cannot be heard.

The mike system is not functional. Hon. Deputy Speaker, when the Sittings finish today, please ensure that these archaic things are restored to the proper order and functional so that we can hear what is being said.
(The Deputy Speaker) I, of course, can hear it.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) That is because you are at the head table.
(The Deputy Speaker) But, I do not know about the other Members. Can you all hear it?
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) Hon. Deputy Speaker, can I go ahead with the Answer now?
(The Deputy Speaker) Yes. ( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera)
(a) Hon. Member, the information you have asked
for in a(i), (ii) and (iii) are given below as a table.
(ii) Through the relevant Head of Mission.

(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Thank you, Hon. Deputy Minister, for the Answer. With the revelation of the information about the key officials, I am sure the Ministry of External Affairs has a reservoir of talents. Every official whom you mentioned has an experience of more than 15 years. Is their experience being put to use by the Ministry of External Affairs or is there a political dimension to the work of the Ministry because latterly, you have been making more enemies than friends around the world. So, this reservoir of talents, I hope, is put to good use so that we will have more friends internationally than enemies. Hon. Deputy Minister, would you please elaborate on that?

( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) Hon. Member, we are carrying on the "Mahinda Chintana" policy of the leadership and those officials who are capable of handling any issue are doing it very well and we have made more friends than enemies.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) That is your perception. ( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) That is what is happening. ( )
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Deputy Minister, my second Supplementary Question is this. Latterly, you have made more non-

career appointments to the diplomatic positions rather than career diplomats in the Ministry of External Affairs. As a result, 54 per cent of your ambassadorial positions have been selected from outside. With this, there is also militarization of the diplomactic corps and three countries have rejected the nominees you have put forward. So, I would appreciate, if whatever chintanaya that you believe in carries forward the countrys policy, that it does not alienate itself from the European Union, the USA, Japan, India et cetera. I would appreciate if a spontaneous answer comes from you.

( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) If I am to mention two officers, Admiral Thisara Samarasinghe and the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Japan, both of whom had served as the Commander of the Navy, are doing a fantastic job.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Deputy Minister, if you can answer my Question rather than go on a voyage of discovery, it would be better.
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) I am telling you about the military appointments and non-career diplomats.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) I asked about the rejected nominees. If you answer to that, it would be easier.

( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) You were asking me about non-career diplomats. So, I mentioned two non-career diplomats who had been in the military as well. I am answering both your questions with the same answer.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) My Question was not about that. My Question was about the 55 per cent non-career diplomats appointed and about the two military people who have been rejected. If you answer that, it would be easier.
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) For political reasons, they may get rejected but we have sent the best officers to serve the country. So, that is
the situation. We pay more attention to security intelligence rather than face the consequences of the war. So, we would like to prevent issues rather than face issues.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Deputy Minister, I know that you have a very difficult brief to make at this particular moment. But, the question that I posed to you is -
(The Deputy Speaker) Hon. Member, that is your third Supplementary Question.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, the time seems to be against you today. Your amiable, generous disposition -
(The Deputy Speaker) Look at the time. It is past 2.00 p.m. ( )
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, we are on the 14th Question. ( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) No, this is the 13th Question. ( )

(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Deputy Minister, the Labour GSP, which is so important to the commercial activities of this country, was taken off from Sri Lanka two years ago. At that particular moment, we said the loss to the country would be roughly about Rs. 1.4 billion. Today, collectively, the loss is about Rs. 5 billion. Now, I am informed that the Government, which rejected certain policies that had to be implemented earlier, has stealthily applied back again to the European Union for that. So, have you now accepted those conditions or things they expected you to do or have you not applied again?
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) Actually, that does not come under our Ministry although we facilitate it to be achieved through other Ministries.

(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) But, Ambassador Ravinatha Aryasinha - ( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) That is only facilitated by us but it is the task of the Ministry of Labour and Labour Relations or the Ministry of Industry and Commerce. The GSP Plus comes under the Ministry of Industry and Commerce; labour comes under the Ministry of Labour and Labour Relations. Therefore, we are only facilitators of those Ministries. So, I will not be able to answer you regarding those matters.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) But, Hon. Deputy Minister, facilitation comes under you.
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) For us, it is a matter of forwarding the documents; taking decisions is for those Ministries.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) So, you are only a postman, is it? ( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) The Question you are asking is not relevant to our Ministry.
(The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) But, facilitation for what purpose? If you say that you are only facilitating -
( ) (The Hon. Neomal Perera) Hon. Member, it does not come under the Ministry of External Affairs.

commence the above training by granting the aforesaid approval?

ASSASSINATION OF MRS. S.P LIYANAGE : PROPER
) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon.
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs:
(i) Mrs. S.P. Liyanage, a retired principal who
resided at Jayasetha, Karagoda, Yakkalamulla in Galle had been mysteriously killed in her compound between 8.30 a.m. to 9.30 a.m. on 09th January, 2012; and
(ii) the suspects of the aforesaid murder have not
been taken into custody up to now?
(i) whether action will be taken to get the suspects
arrested by deploying experienced and capable officers and to conduct a proper investigation into this death; and
: LAND BELONGING TO DEPARTMENT OF MINOR EXPORT

(a) Is he aware that there is a land in the village of
Thibbatumulla in the Ukuwela Divisional Secretarys Division in the Matale District that belongs to the Department of Minor Export Crops?
(iii) the extent in which no cultivation has been

minor export crops that have been cultivated;

of the above land that belongs to the Department of Minor Export Crops?
(i) whether this land that belongs to the Department of Minor Export Crops has been acquired by some persons; and
(ii) if it has been so acquired, on what basis has it been done? (d) If not, why?
) ( - . ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. A.

(b) Will he also state whether the authorities are
charging Rs. 11 Lakhs of annual fee for a private bus route licence only from Colombo to Jaffna whereas only Rs. 3000/- is charged for a route licence in other districts?

AGALAWATTA NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF LANGUAGE EDUCATION AND TRAINING : EMPLOYEES RECRUITED
) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon.
asked the Minister of National Languages and Social Integration:
(i) of the number of employees who have been
recruited to the Agalawatta National Institute of Language Education and Training from the year 2005 up to now;
(ii) separately, of the date on which each of the
aforesaid employee was recruited and their education and other qualifications; and
(iii) the scheme of recruitment adopted to recruit
(i) whether he is aware that the employees in the
aforesaid institution allege that unsuitable persons have been recruited to the aforesaid posts; and
(ii) whether action will be taken to remove
unsuitable persons if appointments have been given to such persons as per the said allegations?
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara - Minister of National Languages and Social Integration) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:
PROGRAMME AIRED BY SRI LANKA BROADCASTING
ABHIMANI SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT AND CULTURAL FOUNDATION (INCORPORATION) BILL
. . Order for Second Reading read. ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , " ( ) " .
Bill accordingly read a Second time, and allocated by MR. DEPUTY SPEAKER to Standing Committee"A" under Standing Order 48(3).
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) . . Seconded. , . . Question put, and agreed to.
Whereupon MR. DEPUTY SPEAKER left the Chair, and THE HON. GAYANTHA KARUNATILEKA took the Chair.
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, I rise to a point of Order.
( ) (The Presiding Member) Order, please! There is a point of Order being raised. point of Order .

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, it is the duty of the Opposition to maintain the Quorum because an Hon. Member from the Opposition has moved the Adjournment Motion. There is no Quorum in the House; it is their duty to maintain the Quorum. Sir, there is no Quorum. .
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) "Why" . Adjournment Motion . ? Sir, there is no Quorum. Quorum bell .
( ) (The Presiding Member) Yes, Hon. Ravi Karunanayake.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Mr. Presiding Member, the Hon. Azwer is not a member of the Committee on Parliamentary Business. At that particular Party Leaders Meeting there was a request made by the Government about this - [Interruption.]

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, I rise to a point of Order. No one can talk now and you have to expunge whatever he said, Sir. When an Hon. Member raises a question on Quorum, no one has the right to speak.
( ) (The Hon. Tissa Attanayake) Adjournment Motion Quorum? Adjournment Motion .
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) During an Adjournment debate, there is no need of a Quorum. - [Interruption.]
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, there is no Quorum. [ ]
( ) (The Presiding Member) .[ ] ... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) , . [Interruption.] Quorum 20 Members clearly mention .
Hon. Member Quorum . So, I have the right to raise this issue, Sir, and you have to give the verdict according to the Standing Orders. - [Interruption.]
Whereupon THE HON. GAYANTHA KARUNATILEKA left the Chair and MR. DEPUTY CHAIRMAN OF COMMITTEES [THE HON. MURUGESU CHANDRAKUMAR] took the Chair.
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, I rise to a point of Order.
( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) Order, please! There is a point of Order being raised by the Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer.

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Hon. Deputy Chairman of Committees, I have to bring to your kind notice the validity and the operation of the Standing Orders of Parliament, which should be strictly adhered to by the House. Sir, Standing Order No. 10 is about the Quorum, which states, I quote:

"The quorum of Parliament required by Article 73 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka is twenty members including the person presiding. If at any time the attention of Mr. Speaker or other person presiding is directed to the fact that a quorum is not present he shall order the division bells to be rung and if at the expiration of five minutes a quorum be not present he shall adjourn Parliament without question put."
So, Sir, I raise, according to the Standing Orders, that there is no Quorum, which I am entitled to. Therefore,

Sir, I am once again raising it when you are in the Chair, that you have to call for the Quorum and if the Quorum is formed, then you can continue with the Debate. If not, Standing Order No. 11 states, I quote:
........If a quorum be not then present Parliament shall adjourn as provided in the preceding Order but if a quorum be proved to be present Parliament shall forthwith resolve itself into Committee."
So, Sir, according to that, you have to call for the Quorum.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) . . rose. ( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) Yes, Hon. Lakshman Kiriella.
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, when you raise the question of Quorum, nobody can argue about it.
( ) (The Hon. Tissa Attanayake) , , . This is a very important Debate.
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Nobody can debate that, Sir.
( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, what do you want to say?
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) , Parliamentary Business Committee Adjournment Motions Quorum . . [ ]

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) ? ... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) According to the Standing Orders - [Interruption.] ( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) We have to follow the Standing Orders.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Yes, but sometimes, - [Interruption.] For example, during the Budget Debate -
Sir, you cannot allow this. I have already raised my objection - [Interruption.]
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Will you shut up,
[ .] [ ] [Expunged on the order of the Chair.]
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) You shut up.
( ) (The Hon. Tissa Attanayake) ? ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) You sit down. - [Interruption.]
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, I am only asking you -
( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) I have to act according to the Standing Orders.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Hon. Deputy Chairman of Committees, kindly listen to me. . [ ]
Right, I am calling for the Quorum.
Parliament counted, and a Quorum not being present, the Division Bells were ordered to be rung.
Later, a Quorum not being present, MR. DEPUTY CHAIRMAN OF COMMITTEES adjourned Parliament, without Question put, under Standing Order No. 10.
Adjourned accordingly at 3.02 p.m. until 1.00 p.m.on Tuesday, 23rd July, 2013.
Corrections which Members suggest for the Final Print should be clearly marked in their copy and sent to be Editor of HANSARD within two weeks of

Subscriptions : The annual subscription for Official Report of Hansard is Rs. 2,178. A single copy of Hansard is available for

Rs. 18.15. (Postage Rs. 2.50) Copies can be obtained by remitting in advance an annual subscription fee to the SUPERINTENDENT, GOVERNMENT PUBLICATIONS BUREAU, No. 102, Piyasiri Building, Pamankada Road,
Kirulapone, Colombo 6. The fee should reach him on or before November 30 each year.
Late applications for subscriptions will not be accepted.
